missing.title: Service not available right now
missing.description: We could not load this service detail. Please return to the overview or message us and we will help you find the right support.

transition.title: Transition package
transition.tagline: Six sessions to land gently in a new chapter.
transition.summary: Relocation, role change or returning after a pause can stretch logistics, identity and relationships. This container gives you structured time to choose what to carry forward and what to leave behind.
summaryPoints: You set the agenda. We hold space for the feelings and admin that arrive in the same week.
We design grounded experiments so you can test decisions without burning bridges.
Sessions are online, confidential and culturally aware (English or Mandarin).

suitable.title: Who this is for
bullets: Mid-career professionals relocating to or within the UK while managing family expectations.
People stepping into a new organisation or sector with uneven support and invisible labour.
Returners navigating skill rustiness, care responsibilities and visa processes at once.

process.title: How the transition package flows
steps: Intro call: we map your change landscape, boundaries and decision points.
Session 1–2: stabilise your footing—naming supports, stressors and capacity.
Session 3–4: design experiments and agreements that honour your constraints.
Session 5–6: review learning, close loops and script next steps with consent.

icf.title: Boundaries & ethics
icf.intro: This work follows ICF core competencies: partnership, confidentiality, consent and respect for your agency.
bullets: Coaching only—we do not replace legal, immigration, financial or therapeutic professionals.
We discuss power, equity and safety without promising outcomes we cannot control.
If we notice you may benefit from other support, we will pause and signpost options.

cases.title: Visa-approved but untethered
cases.body: A project manager arrived in the UK ahead of their partner. We mapped the emotional load of distance, crafted scripts for negotiating flexible hours, and built a ‘weekend restoration’ ritual. By session six they had a relocation rhythm that protected their health.

cases.title: Promotion plus parenting
cases.body: A department lead returning from leave feared being seen as unreliable. We designed consent-based updates with their team, identified where to decline extra duties, and rehearsed asking for mentoring. They left with a plan that balanced visibility and sustainable pace.

cta.body: Curious whether Transition fits? Book a 20-minute chat and note ‘Transition’. We will confirm scope before you commit.

confidence.title: Confidence & voice
confidence.tagline: Five sessions to strengthen your voice without abandoning nuance or care.
confidence.summary: This coaching arc helps you speak up with steadiness, especially when culture, language or past experiences make visibility feel risky.
who: Leaders or emerging managers who want to advocate without mimicking dominant styles.
Professionals navigating imposter feelings after moving countries, sectors or seniority levels.
People who want to set boundaries kindly yet firmly in collaborative spaces.
topics: Tracing the narratives that mute your voice and choosing what to keep or release.
Designing language, rituals and supports that help you show up with integrity.
Practising consent-based conversations about expectations, feedback and power.
Building repeatable experiments to test new behaviours in real meetings.
how: Five 55–60 minute sessions over two to three months, held online.
Pre-session prompts to gather real scenarios you want to rehearse or reframe.
Optional recorded reflections you can revisit privately between sessions.
We can coach bilingually (English/Mandarin) if that supports expression.
approach: We slow down automatic responses so you can choose aligned action.
We celebrate quiet strength as much as visible leadership.
We use somatic, narrative and systems-aware questions—always with consent.
boundaries: We do not provide executive assessments or competency scoring.
We do not override organisational policies or intervene on your behalf.
We stay within coaching; trauma or medical care sits with qualified practitioners.
You decide which experiments to run and how to evaluate them.
not: Not a ‘speak louder’ bootcamp or charismatic persona training.
Not public relations, crisis communications or media coaching.
Not performance management disguised as support for someone else’s agenda.
notIncluded: Formal psychometric tools or personality diagnostics.
Template scripts to copy without adaptation.
reflection: Where do I already show courage, even if it looks quiet?
When do I shrink back, and what am I protecting when that happens?
What support do I need around me to practise new ways of speaking up?
confidence.cta: Mention ‘Confidence & voice’ when you contact us. We will explore your context, boundaries and aims before confirming the series.

reset.title: Reset package
reset.tagline: Four sessions to rebuild steady habits after a season of depletion.
reset.summary: This is a short, structured reset when you feel foggy, overextended or unsure how to restart. We focus on capacity, consent and small experiments so you can move without overcommitting.
summaryPoints: We work in plain language—naming the pressures and supports you already hold.
You leave each session with one gentle experiment, not an overwhelming plan.
Between sessions you can request a short written reflection to keep momentum.

suitable.title: Who this is for
bullets: Professionals returning from burnout leave or an intense life season.
Parents or carers recalibrating energy after a child-care or elder-care sprint.
Community organisers who need a pause to renegotiate commitments and boundaries.

process.title: How the reset unfolds
steps: Intro call: surface what feels heavy, what is non-negotiable and the support you have.
Session 1: audit energy leaks and identify a minimum viable routine.
Session 2–3: test new agreements, boundaries or rituals and review their impact.
Session 4: document what to keep, what to release and how you will notice drift.

icf.title: Boundaries & ethics
icf.intro: We uphold ICF ethics—confidentiality, informed consent and respect for your pace.
bullets: We are not therapists or medical professionals; we help you notice patterns and choose actions.
We will flag red flags (e.g. acute distress, safety concerns) and suggest other care when needed.
You stay in charge of commitments—we coach, we do not enforce or track productivity.

cases.title: Reclaiming lunch breaks
cases.body: An HR partner who had worked through layoffs felt guilty taking breaks. We mapped their nervous-system cues, designed a two-hour no-meeting block, and rehearsed boundary scripts. Within a month they were eating and resting without apology.

cta.body: Ready for a gentler reset? Book a 20-minute chat and mention ‘Reset’. We will confirm scope and timing together.

deepening.title: Deepening package
deepening.tagline: Eight sessions to deepen leadership presence and relational impact.
deepening.summary: When you have initial stability but crave more nuance, Deepening offers a longer arc. We explore power, relationship patterns and legacy so you can lead with alignment across cultures and systems.
summaryPoints: We map the systems you influence—teams, communities, stakeholders—and the stories you hold.
You practise conversations about power, feedback and conflict with real scenarios.
We build in pauses for integration so insights translate into daily practice.

suitable.title: Who this is for
bullets: Leaders stewarding multicultural teams who want to align values and decisions.
Practitioners holding space for others (coaches, facilitators, community leads).
Founders balancing sustainability, justice and growth without burning out themselves.

process.title: How the deepening arc works
steps: Intro call: explore your long-term aims, influences and non-negotiables.
Sessions 1–3: map leadership stories, identities and patterns that shape your presence.
Sessions 4–6: practise conversations, decisions and boundary-setting with real-life stakes.
Sessions 7–8: consolidate learning, agree ongoing supports and note future check-ins.

icf.title: Boundaries & ethics
icf.intro: We stay within ICF coaching—curious questions, reflective feedback and collaborative design.
bullets: We do not provide consulting deliverables or intervene with your stakeholders.
We maintain confidentiality and only share themes externally with your written consent.
We honour cultural context and invite you to challenge us if something feels off.

cases.title: Making space for feedback
cases.body: A charity director felt defensive when staff raised equity concerns. Together we mapped their triggers, practised a three-step response, and set up a feedback council. They reported less dread and clearer next steps after tough conversations.

cases.title: Leading across cultures
cases.body: A tech lead managing teams in Taipei and London struggled with conflicting expectations. We explored decision rights, co-created communication agreements and rehearsed bilingual framing. They left with meeting structures that respected both teams’ norms.

cta.body: Deepening is a longer commitment. Book a 20-minute chat and mention ‘Deepening’ so we can confirm fit and scheduling.

experiments.title: Experiments & stewardship
experiments.tagline: Four sessions to design ethical experiments when you want change without harm.
experiments.summary: Ideal for community builders, founders or intrapreneurs who hold responsibility for people and impact. We help you design experiments that respect capacity, consent and data.
who: Leaders testing new programmes or services who need a thinking partner for ethical risk.
Teams exploring culture change, equity or sustainability shifts without over-claiming.
Practitioners balancing innovation with care for staff, volunteers or beneficiaries.
topics: Clarifying the stewardship question: who is affected, who decides, who is accountable.
Mapping assumptions and designing experiments that surface learning without causing harm.
Agreeing decision gates, consent processes and communications that keep agency with stakeholders.
Reviewing data with context so you respond, iterate or stop responsibly.
how: Four 70-minute sessions over eight to ten weeks, online with collaborative tools.
Shared working documents so actions, decisions and risks stay visible.
Between-session check-ins focused on accountability you define.
We can include up to two stakeholders in selected sessions with prior consent.
approach: We blend coaching with reflective facilitation while keeping you in authorship.
We foreground ethics, accessibility and impact alongside innovation.
We pace experiments so learning integrates rather than overwhelms.
boundaries: We do not provide legal, safeguarding or financial audits.
We do not run the experiments for you or manage your team.
We avoid conflicts of interest and name them if they arise.
You remain accountable to the people and systems you serve.
not: Not a rapid-growth accelerator or venture fundraising programme.
Not a substitute for specialist consulting or compliance work.
Not a guarantee that every idea will land or scale.
notIncluded: Hands-on project management or implementation support.
Marketing, sales or investor outreach on your behalf.
reflection: What change am I stewarding, and who trusts me to do this with care?
Where do I need more consent, clarity or data before moving forward?
What conditions would tell me to pause, stop or celebrate progress?
experiments.cta: If you are ready to steward experiments with integrity, book the 20-minute chat and note ‘Experiments’. We will check scope and capacity together.

checkIn.title: Single session check-in
checkIn.tagline: A 75-minute conversation to steady yourself before the next step.
checkIn.subtitle: A 75-minute conversation to steady yourself before the next step.
checkIn.summary: A single, focused session for when you need a calm, confidential space to reflect before deciding what comes next.
who: You need a one-off reflective space before a decision or courageous conversation.
You want to experience our coaching style before committing to a longer package.
You have worked with us before and want a guided reset between packages.
topics: Mapping what is present right now—emotions, constraints and choices.
Clarifying what you want from the upcoming decision, conversation or change.
Designing one small experiment or pause that honours your capacity.
how: 75-minute coaching session on Zoom.
Short pre-session prompt so you arrive with focus.
Summary notes with observations and optional questions within two working days.
Option to schedule a follow-up within 30 days if we both agree it is useful.
approach: Grounded, ICF-aligned coaching that keeps you in authorship.
We move at your pace and use questions, reflection and somatic cues.
We keep scope to one core topic so you leave with clarity.
boundaries: Not therapy, crisis support or clinical advice.
We do not give legal, financial or immigration recommendations.
You remain responsible for decisions and follow-up actions.
Confidentiality follows ICF ethics and safeguarding law.
not: Not an emergency appointment or on-call service.
Not a substitute for ongoing support if your situation needs a series.
Not a place for someone else’s performance management.
notIncluded: Written reports for employers or institutions.
Contacting third parties on your behalf.
reflection: What feels most important to acknowledge before we meet?
What would feeling ‘more resourced’ at the end of the session look like?
What ongoing support might I need after this conversation?
checkIn.cta: Mention ‘Check-in session’ in the form and share a few lines about your context. We will confirm fit and schedule with care.

newToUk.title: New to the UK coaching arc
newToUk.tagline: Three sessions to orient gently to life, work and support networks in the UK.
newToUk.subtitle: Three sessions to orient gently to life, work and support networks in the UK.
newToUk.summary: We create a steady container for the first months of relocation so you can integrate, make decisions and ask for support without burning out.
who: Professionals who relocated to the UK within the last 12 months.
Partners, carers or students adjusting to new systems alongside work or study.
People balancing visas, housing and community building while staying well.
topics: Naming what feels unfamiliar or overwhelming about UK systems and culture.
Designing rhythms that respect health, relationships and finances.
Mapping networks and requesting support with consent.
Deciding what needs action now, later or not at all.
how: Three 60-minute sessions across six to eight weeks, online via Zoom.
Optional asynchronous check-ins for key paperwork or conversations.
Resource suggestions tailored to your region, language and needs.
We can involve a partner or trusted ally for part of a session if that helps.
approach: We blend practical planning with emotional regulation and narrative work.
We acknowledge migration realities, racism and bureaucracy without blame.
We keep you in authorship of choices; we do not take over decisions.
boundaries: We do not provide immigration, housing or legal services.
We do not guarantee job offers, sponsorship or specific outcomes.
We stay within coaching; therapy or clinical care sits with qualified providers.
You choose what information to share and what actions to take.
not: Not a relocation agency or concierge service.
Not financial planning or tax advice.
notIncluded: Completion of visa forms or legal paperwork.
Direct contact with employers, landlords or authorities on your behalf.
reflection: What part of settling in feels most tender or confusing right now?
What would feeling more at home in three months look like?
Who could be part of your support web as you integrate?
newToUk.cta: Note ‘New to the UK’ in your message. We will confirm scope, timelines and whether this arc fits your situation.
newToUk.ctaButton: Start the New to the UK arc

returning.title: Returning client tune-up
returning.tagline: Three sessions to reconnect with coaching after a pause.
returning.subtitle: Three sessions to reconnect with coaching after a pause.
returning.summary: Designed for previous clients who want a fresh container for new experiments while honouring past learning.
who: Previous SustainSage clients who want support for a new chapter.
People who completed a package and now face a fresh transition.
Clients who want accountability to integrate decisions made earlier.
topics: Reviewing what has shifted since we last worked together.
Naming new boundaries, capacities or constraints.
Designing experiments or agreements that fit current contexts.
Celebrating progress and deciding what closure or continuation looks like.
how: Three 55-minute sessions over six to eight weeks, online.
We revisit earlier notes to connect past and present learning.
Optional asynchronous check-ins between sessions if mutually agreed.
Bilingual coaching (English/Mandarin) remains available if helpful.
approach: We honour existing trust while re-contracting boundaries and goals.
We stay curious about what needs to be different this time.
We continue to coach—you remain responsible for decisions.
boundaries: We do not skip consent or agreements even if we worked together before.
We do not provide therapy, consulting or crisis support.
We will name if another professional might now be a better fit.
You decide pace, scope and when to close again.
not: Not an open-ended retainer or on-call support.
Not a replacement for supervision, therapy or HR processes.
Not a promise that previous goals or methods will still apply.
notIncluded: Deliverables for your organisation without a separate agreement.
reflection: What has changed since we last worked together?
What support do I want this time that I did not ask for before?
How will I know this tune-up has served me?
returning.cta: Mention ‘Returning client’ in your note so we can review history and confirm availability.
